item.title: Stacy P add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "If I am good enough and quiet enough, perhaps after all they will let me go; but it’s not easy being quiet and good, it’s like hanging on to the edge of a bridge when you’ve already fallen over; you don’t seem to be moving, just dangling there, and yet it is taking all your strength." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Stacy P add a quote by Richard Matheson
item.description:
"It’s horrible," she said.
He looked at her in surprise. Horrible? Wasn’t that odd? He hadn’t thought that for years. For him the word “horror” had become obsolete. A surfeiting of terror made terror a cliché. To Robert Neville the situation merely existed as natural fact. It had no adjectives." -- Richard Matheson

item.title: Stacy P add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "I wondered if that was how forgiveness budded; not with the fanfare of epiphany, but with pain gathering its things, packing up, and slipping away unannounced in the middle of the night." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Stacy P add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "Then I felt too that I might take this opportunity to tie up a few loose ends, only of course loose ends can never be properly tied, one is always producing new ones. Time, like the sea, unties all knots. Judgements on people are never final, they emerge from summings up which at once suggest the need of a reconsideration. Human arrangements are nothing but loose ends and hazy reckoning, whatever art may otherwise pretend in order to console us." -- Iris Murdoch

item.title: Stacy P add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "How different each death is, and yet it leads us into the self-same country, that country which we inhabit so rarely, where we see the worthlessness of what we have long pursued and will so soon return to pursuing." -- Iris Murdoch

item.title: Stacy P add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "I may add here that one of the secrets of my happy life is that i have never made the mistake of learning to drive a car. I have never lacked people, usually women, longing to drive me withersoever I wanted. Why keep bitches and bark yourself?" -- Iris Murdoch

item.title: Stacy P add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "It was a piece of thoroughly picturesque and proper violence. I like a violent man, really, a man who's a bit of a brute in a decent straightforward way." -- Iris Murdoch
